markdown.markdown: I am interested in leveraging high-throughput biological data to understand neurological disorders and chronic disease. Specifically, I am currently researching how sex and developmental stage affect multi-omics profiles of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Additionally, I am creating new methods to characterize the relationship between exposure, health outcomes, and multi-omics signatures. ## Skills :::: {.columns} ::: {.column} ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Software ** * R/RShiny * Python * Linux * HPC/SLURM * HTML/CSS * Version Control/Git/Docker ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Domain Knowledge** * Bioinformatics * Toxicology * Neuroimmunology * Pharmacology ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Data Analysis** * Single-cell/nuclei RNA-seq, Spatial transcriptomics * Bulk Methods: RNA-seq, Methylation, Proteomics, Metabolomics * Quality Control * Exploratory Data Analysis * Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence * Statistical Modeling * Pipeline Development ::: ::: :::: ## Professional Experience ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **PhD Candidate, Toxicology, Physiology, and Molecular Mechanisms** *Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health · Full-time* Sep 2023 – Present · Baltimore, MD - Research neurodevelopmental and chronic conditions using multi-omics data - Assist in teaching classes at the Bloomberg School of Public Health - Complete coursework in toxicology, pharmacology, and molecular biology ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Bioinformatics Scientist** *Tufts University* Jan 2022 – Sep 2023 · 1 yr 9 mos - Develop omics data workflows and curate reference data to support bioinformatics research on Tufts HPC and Galaxy Server - Consult on bioinformatics projects and provide input on workflow design and optimization - Develop and lead omics data analysis and visualization seminars ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Clinical Bioinformatics Analyst** *Foundation Medicine · Full-time* Jan 2021 – Dec 2021 · 1 yr - Lead team to develop R package / Shiny app for analysis and visualization - Analyze clinical oncology NGS data and annotate genomic aberrations to inform oncologists of actionable drug targets - Implement and design SQL queries to obtain relevant data - Collaborate in cross-disciplinary teams to complete projects and implement process improvements ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Histology Systems Specialist** *Foundation Medicine · Full-time* Jul 2020 – Jan 2021 · 7 mos · Cambridge, MA - Develop and analyze performance metrics for Histology team using R, Python, and Power BI - Test and improve technology products to meet evolving workflow needs - Update and revise SOPs to reflect changes in lab processes ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Histotechnologist** *Foundation Medicine* Oct 2018 – Jul 2020 · 1 yr 10 mos · Cambridge, MA - Operated in CLIA/CAP environment with pathologists to assess tumor composition of cancer patient samples - Performed validation of new processes and updated SOPs ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Pathology Technician II** *Covance* Jun 2016 – Aug 2018 · 2 yrs 3 mos · Madison, WI - Assisted pathologists in assessing efficacy of new medical therapies via tissue preparation - Identified and resolved issues in documentation, GLP/SOP compliance, and process improvements ::: ## Teaching Experience ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Molecular Toxicology Teaching Assistant** *Johns Hopkins University* 2024/2025 - Assisted with lectures and grading of assignents. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Introduction To Risk Sciences Teaching Assistant** *Johns Hopkins University* 2024 - Assisted with lectures and grading of assignents. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Introduction to Bioinformatics - Recurring Guest Lecturer** *Tufts University* 2022/2023 - Lectured on the principles of RNA-seq, and led a live workshop on how to analyze RNA-seq data. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Protein Engineering Course - Recurring Guest Lecturer** *Tufts University* 2022/2023 - Lectured on the background and use of AlphaFold in protein engineering research and led a live workshop on how to use AlphaFold. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Introduction To 16S Metabarcoding** *Tufts University* 2022 - Lectured on 16S Metabarcoding data analysis to profile microbial communities and led a live workshop on how to analyze microbiome data. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Animal Histology Teaching Assistant** *Binghamton University* 2015 - Taught students about tissue composition, lesion formation, and tissue identification under microscope - Proctored exams and supported laboratory preparation for classes ::: ## Education ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **PhD, Toxicology, Physiology, and Molecular Mechanisms** *Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health* Sep 2023 - May 2026 ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Master of Science - MS, Bioinformatics** *Brandeis University* 2019 - 2021 ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Bachelor's degree, Biological Sciences** *SUNY Binghamton* 2013 - 2016 ::: ## Memberships ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Carpentries Instructor** *The Carpentries* Issued Oct 2022 ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **American Society of Human Genetics** ::: ## Publications [ORCHiD ](https://orcid.org/0009-0000-5994-2236){.btn .btn-primary} [Google Scholar ](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=nPusJFYAAAAJ&hl=en){.btn .btn-primary} ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Human neural organoid microphysiological systems show the building blocks necessary for basic learning and memory** *Communications Biology* · 2025-08-16 | Journal article DOI: [10.1038/s42003-025-08632-5](https://doi.org/10.1038/s42003-025-08632-5) Contributors: Dowlette-Mary Alam El Din; Leah Moenkemoeller; Alon Loeffler; Forough Habibollahi; Jack Schenkman; Amitav Mitra; Tjitse van der Molen; Lixuan Ding; **Jason Laird**; Maren Schenke et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Single Cell Transcriptomic Profiling of *MYBPC3*-Associated Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Across Species Reveals Conservation of Biological Process But Not Gene Expression** *Journal of the American Heart Association* · 2025-01-07 | Journal article DOI: [10.1161/jaha.124.035780](https://doi.org/10.1161/jaha.124.035780) Contributors: Samia A. Ali; Gayani Perera; **Jason Laird**; Rebecca Batorsky; Martin S. Maron; Victor N. Rivas; Joshua A. Stern; Samantha Harris; Michael T. Chin ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Network Analysis of Brain and Bone Tissue Transcripts Reveals Shared Molecular Mechanisms Underlying Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias and Osteoporosis** *The Journals of Gerontology, Series A: Biological Sciences and Medical Sciences* · 2024-11-01 | Journal article DOI: [10.1093/gerona/glae211](https://doi.org/10.1093/gerona/glae211) Contributors: Archana Nagarajan; **Jason Laird**; Obiadada Ugochukwu; Sjur Reppe; Kaare Gautvik; Ryan D Ross; David A Bennett; Clifford Rosen; Douglas P Kiel; Lenora A Higginbotham et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Human Neural Organoid Microphysiological Systems Show the Building Blocks Necessary for Basic Learning and Memory** *Preprint* · 2024-09-19 DOI: [10.1101/2024.09.17.613333](https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.09.17.613333) Contributors: Dowlette-Mary Alam El Din; Leah Moenkemoeller; Alon Loeffler; Forough Habibollahi; Jack Schenkman; Amitav Mitra; Tjitse van der Molen; Lixuan Ding; **Jason Laird**; Maren Schenke et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Protosequences in brain organoids model intrinsic brain states** *Preprint* · 2023-12-30 DOI: [10.1101/2023.12.29.573646](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.12.29.573646) Contributors: Tjitse van der Molen; Alex Spaeth; Mattia Chini; Sebastian Hernandez; Gregory A. Kaurala; Hunter E. Schweiger; Cole Duncan; Sawyer McKenna; Jinghui Geng; Max Lim et al.; **Jason Laird** ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Transcriptomic network analysis of brain and bone reveals shared molecular mechanisms underlying Alzheimer’s Disease and related dementias (ADRD) and Osteoporosis** *Preprint* · 2023-10-28 DOI: [10.1101/2023.10.26.559969](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.10.26.559969) Contributors: Archana Nagarajan; **Jason Laird**; Obiadada Ugochukwu; Sjur Reppe; Kaare Gautvik; Ryan D. Ross; David A. Bennett; Clifford Rosen; Douglas P. Kiel; Lenora A. Higginbotham et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Focal and Normal Areas of Myocyte Disarray in Human Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy** *International Journal of Molecular Sciences* · 2023-08-10 | Journal article DOI: [10.3390/ijms241612625](https://doi.org/10.3390/ijms241612625) Contributors: **Jason Laird**; Gayani Perera; Rebecca Batorsky; Hongjie Wang; Knarik Arkun; Michael T. Chin ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Abstract EC.09: Single Nuclei RNA Sequencing Analysis Of *Mybpc-3*-Associated HCM To Identify Common Pathological Mechanisms In Human, Feline, And Murine Hearts** *Circulation Research* · 2023-08-04 | Journal article DOI: [10.1161/res.133.suppl_1.ec.09](https://doi.org/10.1161/res.133.suppl_1.ec.09) Contributors: Samia Ali; Gayani Perera; **Jason Laird**; Rebecca Batorsky; Joshua A Stern; Samantha Harris; Michael T Chin ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Continuous fish muscle cell line with capacity for myogenic and adipogenic-like phenotypes** *Scientific Reports* · 2023-03-29 | Journal article DOI: [10.1038/s41598-023-31822-2](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-023-31822-2) Contributors: Michael K. Saad; John S. K. Yuen; Connor M. Joyce; Xinxin Li; Taehwan Lim; Talia L. Wolfson; Justin Wu; **Jason Laird**; Sanjana Vissapragada; Olivia P. Calkins et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Altered intercellular communication in human hypertrophic cardiomyopathy inferred from single nuclei RNA-seq, Ligand-Receptor gene expression analysis and spatial transcriptomics** *Journal of Molecular and Cellular Cardiology* · 2022-12 | Journal article DOI: [10.1016/j.yjmcc.2022.08.090](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.yjmcc.2022.08.090) Contributors: Michael Chin; Christina Codden; Amy Larson; Gayani Perera; **Jason Laird**; Rebecca Batorsky; Junya Awata ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Activating IGF1R hotspot non-frameshift insertions define a novel, potentially targetable molecular subtype of adenoid cystic carcinoma** *Modern Pathology* · 2022-11 | Journal article DOI: [10.1038/s41379-022-01126-3](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41379-022-01126-3) Contributors: Matthew Margolis; Tyler Janovitz; **Jason Laird**; Douglas A. Mata; Meagan Montesion; Jessica K. Lee; Russell W. Madison; Alexa B. Schrock; Hanna Tukachinsky; Justin M. Allen et al. ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} **Personalized Perturbation Profiles Reveal Concordance between Autism Blood Transcriptome Datasets** *Preprint* · 2021-01-25 DOI: [10.1101/2021.01.25.427953](https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.01.25.427953) Contributors: **Jason Laird**; Alexandra Maertens :::
